Dear Sir,

I am writing to you in response to your recent letter regarding the "Barn Columbia" who came north with you. Also, another friend visited me last year. He was very kind and I feel no badly now that he has left. We brought him here for a visit during the spring.

Poveshell's "music hall" was very popular among the Indians. You have always been an excellent friend.

Sincerely,

[Signature]

Poveshell
Dear Mrs. Burdick,

I am writing to you from Columbia, who came with me to Burdick's last night. We had a great time. Also another night at Burdick's, as we thought it would be too late to go there. So we went there and had a wonderful evening.

Poveshell,

[Signature]

Poveshell, if she knew how to play the "music hall" songs and could sing them, you'd have known more about the music.
